abstract: The Walt Disney Company pulled its ABC station from Cablevision, potentially leaving about three million cable customers in the New York area without access to the Academy Awards.
snippet: The Walt Disney Company pulled its ABC station from Cablevision, potentially leaving about three million cable customers in the New York area without access to the Academy Awards.
lead_paragraph: The Walt Disney Company at 12:01 a.m. on Sunday pulled its ABC station from Cablevision — potentially leaving about three million cable customers in New York, New Jersey and Connecticut without access to the Academy Awards — after failing to reach an agreement with the cable provider on a new contract.

headline.main: No Deal on ABC Is Reached by Disney and Cablevision
headline.print_headline: No Deal on ABC Is Reached By Disney and Cablevision

byline.original: By Brian Stelter and Brooks Barnes
